channel.title: Client Listener Problem
channel.description:
My client IP is echoing back as 0.0.0.0, and my server will not start. Anyone had this problem before? I know Java very well, but I haven't worked with servers and clients much. Any ideas on the problem?
OH and P.S:
I don't have a router, I am directly connected that's not the problem. (And I have disabled my firewall/PG temporarily, that's not the problem either).
NOW any suggestions lol?

item.title: Client Listener Problem
item.dc:creator: @jef3189 jef3189
item.description:
@jef3189 wrote:

problem solved, don’t worry.

Read full topic

item.title: Client Listener Problem
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Give me your external IP address, start your server, and log on using 127.0.0.1.

Read full topic

item.title: Client Listener Problem
item.dc:creator: @jef3189 jef3189
item.description:
@jef3189 wrote:

Well, if I cannot login by using my “external” IP, then noone else will be able to either…I do not know why this is happening.

Read full topic

item.title: Client Listener Problem
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

jef3189:

im using testscape I’ve been doing this for like 1 hour not experienced at all…I’m also using Jcreator to compile the server, cuz that’s what I used to learn java on…is the IP hard-coded into testscape?

Servers do not use IP addresses. It comes up as 0.0.0.0 because it is telling you that the server is running locally. Since you have a direct connection to the internet, then distribue your external IP address (can be found here) to other people and see if they can log on (when your server is running.)

Read full topic

item.title: Client Listener Problem
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

If it is echoing back 0.0.0.0 that is most likely integrated into your source. Have you tried logging onto the server after you have started it?

Read full topic
